etymologies: early 16th century: from French bistorte or medieval Latin bistorta, from bis ‘twice’ + torta (feminine past participle of torquere ‘to twist’)

definitions: a Eurasian herbaceous plant with a spike of flesh-colored flowers and twisted root that is sometimes used medicinally.

notes.text: Genus Polygonum, family Polygonaceae: several species, in particular P. bistorta

shortDefinitions: Eurasian herbaceous plant with spike of flesh-coloured flowers
